text: our architect wants to meet Friday to get updates from us
going to check in with the sub teams to see how its going, please reply promptly so i have some clue of status :simple_smile:
aesthetic team was trying to get a tour of a couple places together, but we’re recalibrating based on the friday meeting
cool - Friday isn't the end all be all, so its fine to state our boundaries.
I'll set up time to meet with my subcoms now

attachments.fallback:
NEED TO HAVE
- good-sized sink with a sprayer
- garbage disposal
- range / oven / hood with proper ventilation
- dishwasher
- fridge (potentially 1 full fridge and one glass fridge with no freezer, for shared items)
- freezer space for bags of ice OR an ice maker - there are times when we need large amounts of ice for events. (not terribly often)
- Trash / Recycling / Compost bins - larger than we have here.
- ethernet drop in or near kitchen for experimentation purposes
- clear traffic flow - the layout of the kitchen/eating area should facilitate movement through it. 

COUNTER SPACE
An island would provides much-needed counterspace / storage, and would work as a serving area for events. When folks are preparing lunch / getting coffee, there should be room for 3-4 people to be actively doing stuff in the kitchen without being on top of one another.

CAFE-LIKE EATING AREA
multiple tables for eating - Potentially a mix of different seating types - tables, booths, bar seating against the window or a wall. Should be able to seat 20-30 people.

WANT TO HAVE
- large commercial fridge?
- several smaller, beverage fridges around the office - large conference room, reception, social space
- don’t want stainless steel countertops…something that's easy to keep clean and maintain.
- taps built into counter or island / kegerator?
- space for 2 microwaves?
- coffee should be relatively close to the reception area
- double oven?
- easy hot water access - whether it’s a tap, a water cooler setup, or a coffee machine tap
- no barstools on island - we should disincentivize folks hanging out in the active kitchen area and encourage them to eat in the cafe / eating space


SNACK SHELVES!
A pantry or open shelving area for communal snacks, plus appropriate containers for snacks (OXO pop tops etc). This should not occlude counter space / be above the counter. Folks should be able to grab snacks without needing to enter the active kitchen area.


LESS ARCHITECTURAL / MORE OUTFITTING STUFF

pump pot machine? - this would make sense for supplying coffee to reception, conference rooms, social space

beer kegerator is a different thing that we think should go in the social space

Kitchen should be bright enough that people feel bad when its dirty

some kind of cart for shuttling stuff between the kitchen and social space or conference room

NEED TO HAVE
- good-sized sink with a sprayer
- garbage disposal
- range / oven / hood with proper ventilation
- dishwasher
- fridge (potentially 1 full fridge and one glass fridge with no freezer, for shared items)
- freezer space for bags of ice OR an ice maker - there are times when we need large amounts of ice for events. (not terribly often)
- Trash / Recycling / Compost bins - larger than we have here.
- ethernet drop in or near kitchen for experimentation purposes
- clear traffic flow - the layout of the kitchen/eating area should facilitate movement through it. 

COUNTER SPACE
An island would provides much-needed counterspace / storage, and would work as a serving area for events. When folks are preparing lunch / getting coffee, there should be room for 3-4 people to be actively doing stuff in the kitchen without being on top of one another.

multiple tables for eating - Potentially a mix of different seating types - tables, booths, bar seating against the window or a wall. Should be able to seat 20-30 people.

WANT TO HAVE
- large commercial fridge?
- several smaller, beverage fridges around the office - large conference room, reception, social space
- don’t want stainless steel countertops…something that's easy to keep clean and maintain.

- no barstools on island - we should disincentivize folks hanging out in the active kitchen area and encourage them to eat in the cafe / eating space


SNACK SHELVES!
A pantry or open shelving area for communal snacks, plus appropriate containers for snacks (OXO pop tops etc). This should not occlude counter space / be above the counter. Folks should be able to grab snacks without needing to enter the active kitchen area.

pump pot machine? - this would make sense for supplying coffee to reception, conference rooms, social space

attachments.pretext: New comment on card "<https://trello.com/c/QcR3dFlE|Serious Kitchen>" by Melissa Chan

attachments.fallback:
In its default state/configuration, the social space could double as collaboration space.

**It should have**
- tables that are light and easy to move
- chairs/seating for ~50 people
- stackable chairs - different ones than we have currently
- potentially stepped seating, seating along window?
- seats should be comfortable for sessions longer than an hour
- display surface - wall or screen for projection, or a large TV— visible to whole social space (big!) A projector + screen + wall gives us some advantages: 1) The wall can be used for other things (i.e. sticky note sessions OR hanging art) and 2) A projector allows for a bigger display than a TV

We like the idea of a mural or wall drawing that would allow us to use the surface of the wall but still provide visual interest when not being used.

- audio/speakers + microphones
- shades - quick change between open and shut for projection
- dimmable or variable lighting - lighting “regions” within the space that can be turned on/off
- power outlets
- lockable space - This is not social space specific, but there is a desire for Uncorked Only vs Public space delination. We should be able to restrict access to the rest of the office during events.

- should be relatively close to the kitchen for moving food/beverages
- dedicated set of garbage/recycling bins!
- presenters will have laptops, so we need some sort of podium or table
- presenters should be able to wire in to display, whatever it is. Currently Apple TV setup is buggy and bad for video
- Some sort of central control panel for controlling lights/shades/projection? It would be nice to not have to go to three different places in the room to turn down the lights, lower the projector, and draw the shades.
- potentially a kegerator and/or beverage fridge in social space

**The social space should FEEL**
- warm and inviting
- comfortable
- like a place where people want to spend time even when there’s not an event going on


**Event Types**
AHM
workshops - tables, power outlets
meet’n’greet
lunch n learn
talks/presentations

text: Finally got a confirmation for the Airbnb tour for this Thursday. I sent out invites to all who expressed interest, now’s your last chance to get in before I send the attending list.
I'd like to jump on that list if possible
yeah thanks Trent!! I'm super excited. Assuming I'm on the attending list since I'm on calendar invite
